text: Cosmos is the debut album by The Send which was released on July 31, 2007 by Tooth & Nail Records. Joseph Kisselburgh teamed up with 'Aaron Sprinkle to "bring spiritual songs into existence from beyond," rather than force a pop record.'http://www.thesendonline.com/biography.php The first single is "An Epiphany". A video was released for this song on July 12, 2007. An e-card was released for the album by Tooth & Nail on July 24, 2007 and can be watched here. Cosmos was available for pre-order, and came autographed with a free limited edition five-song vinyl LP. ==Track listing== #"Need" #"Fairweather" #"An Epiphany" #"Blocking the Sun" #"Begin" #"The Fall" #"Drown" #"Santiam" #"The Science of the Sky" #"Dawn and Dusk" #"Say" #"Fire Colors" #"In Repose" ==Anticipation== Cosmos was placed #16 out of #25 on Jesus Freak Hideout's 2007 highlights. They also gave it a 'Pre-Order Worthy' certification and described it as having 'a lasting impression on the listener.'. ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" !align="center" valign="top" width="150"|Song !align="center" valign="top" width="125"|Chart !align="center" valign="top" width="60"|Position |- |align="center" valign="center"|"An Epiphany" |align="center" valign="top"|Christian Hit Radio |align="center" valign="top"|5 |} ==References== ==External links== *Cosmos E-Card Category:2007 debut albums Category:Tooth & Nail Records albums Category:Albums produced by Aaron Sprinkle
title: Cosmos (The Send album)
